00011 Bleu::Bleu(vector<unsigned int> translation, vector<unsigned int> reference)
00012 {
00013         trans = translation;
00014         ref = reference;

00017 int Bleu::nGramsMatching(unsigned int n)
00018 {
00019         vector<bool>bitvec; // saves whether a ref-ngram  is already used or not.
00020         bitvec.resize(ref.size(),0);
00021 
00022         unsigned int nGramsMatchingCount=0;
00023         
00024         for (unsigned int i=0; i+n-1<trans.size(); i++)
00025         {
00026                 for (unsigned int j=0; j+n-1<ref.size(); j++)
00027                 {
00028                         if (bitvec[j]==0) // this ngram in the ref is not used yet
00029                         {
00030                                 //check if ngrams match
00031                                 unsigned int pos = 0;
00032                                 while ( pos < n
00033                                         && trans[i+pos] == ref[j+pos]
00034                                                                                         ) pos++;
00035                                 if (pos == n)
00036                                 {
00037                                         // matched
00038                                         nGramsMatchingCount++;
00039         
00040                                         // mark ngram in reference as used in the bitvector
00041                                         bitvec[j]=1;
00042                                         
00043                                         // dont count more occurrences in ref for this trans-ngram
00044                                         break; // for (..j..)
00045                                 }
00046                         }
00047                 }
00048         }
00049         return nGramsMatchingCount;
00050 }
00051 
00052 double Bleu::precision(unsigned int n)
00053 {
00054         int nGrams = trans.size() + 1 - n;
00055         // we dont expect nGrams<=0 here, since we're not going to calc the precisions if there are no ngrams for this n
00056         /*if ( nGrams <= 0)
00057         {
00058                 // was wenn nGrams < 0 ?
00059                 cerr << "Bleu::precision: Division durch 0." << endl;
00060                 return 1;
00061         }*/
00062         return (double)nGramsMatching(n)/(double)nGrams;
00063 }
00064 
00065 double Bleu::brevityPenalty()
00066 {
00067         int c = this->trans.size();
00068         int r = this->ref.size();
00069 
00070         if (c > r)
00071                 return 1;
00072         if (c > 0) // (c <= r) gilt hier eh
00073                 return (double)exp(((double)(1-r)/(double)c));
00074 
00075         cerr << "Bleu::brevityPenalty(): Fehler bei der Berechnung. (Länge der Referenzübersetzung <= 0)" << endl;
00076         return -1;
00077 }
00078 
00079 double Bleu::bleuScore(unsigned int N)
00080 {
00081         if (N==0)
00082         {
00083                 cerr << "Bleu::bleuScore: ungültiges N (0)" << endl;
00084                 return 0;
00085         }
00086         /* um die Summe zu berechnen:
00087         * 1. 1/N kann man ausklammern
00088         * 2. log(a)+log(b) = log(a*b) => es reicht die p_n zu multiplizieren und am Ende einmal den log zu berechnen.
00089         */
00090         double akku = 1.0;
00091 
00092         // maybe there are less words in the trans or ref than we would try to get n-grams for.. so we search for the maximum N we can use here.
00093         unsigned int maxN = min(min(N, trans.size()-1), ref.size()-1);
00094         
00095         for (unsigned int i=1; i<=maxN; i++)
00096         {
00097                 akku *= precision(i);
00098         }
00099         if (akku<=0)
00100                 return 0;
00101         return brevityPenalty()*exp(log(akku)/(double)maxN);
00102 }
